verses.roman:
trai-lokye pṛthivī dhanyā
yatra vṛndāvanaṁ purī
tatrāpi gopikāḥ pārtha
yatra rādhābhidhā mama

synonyms: trai-lokye—in the three worlds; pṛthivī—the earth; dhanyā—fortunate; yatra—where; vṛndāvanam—Vṛndāvana; purī—the town; tatra—there; api—certainly; gopikāḥ—the gopīs; pārtha—O Arjuna; yatra—where; rādhā—Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī; abhidhā—named; mama—My.
translation: "O Pārtha, in all the three planetary systems, this earth is especially fortunate, for on earth is the town of Vṛndāvana. And there the gopīs are especially glorious because among them is My Śrīmatī Rādhārāṇī."

purport.content: This verse, spoken by Lord Kṛṣṇa to Arjuna, is cited from the Ādi Purāṇa.
